column4: you guys know what I'm talking about, right, the kingston usb memory thing...after putting that into the usb port, how do I access it?
it should just appear on your desktop
didn't appear on my desktop, I'd like to check it with the file browser, where would it be in the file dir
how do I enable or check hotplug? :)
ps -auwx | grep hotplug in a console
I get bad ps syntax warning and this and the only process I get back is grep hotplug
i restarted it but still don't see anything on my desktop
there is stuff that runs when I plug the memory in, like hald-addon-storage and [usb-storage]  and [scsi_eh_5]  some of those processes belong to user hal
can you pastebin the output of dmesg after you plug it in?
what's the url for your post?
hrm well it's clearly seeing the drive.. ls -al /media pls
I'm asking because I don't have a scsi directory under /dev
and I don't have /dev/sdf1 either, just sda and sda1
ok, I got to go, thanks for the help, I'll try to figure it out later, thx again
